name: R5-Endpoint-R4-Endpoint
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 Endpoint into FHIR R4

element.display: The technical details of an endpoint that can be used for electronic services

target.display: The technical details of an endpoint that can be used for electronic services
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint`

element.display: The technical base address for connecting to this endpoint

target.display: The technical base address for connecting to this endpoint
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.address` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.address`

element.display: Protocol/Profile/Standard to be used with this endpoint connection

target.display: Protocol/Profile/Standard to be used with this endpoint connection
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.connectionType` maps as RelatedTo to R4 `Endpoint.connectionType` - connectionType changed from array to scalar (max cardinality from * to 1); connectionType changed the binding strength from Example to Extensible; connectionType has change due to type change: R5 connectionType CodeableConcept has no equivalent or mapped type in R4 connectionType

element.display: Contact details for source (e.g. troubleshooting)

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.contact` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.contact`

element.display: Contained, inline Resources

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.contained` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.contained`

element.display: Additional details about the endpoint that could be displayed as further information to identify the description beyond its name
The type of environment(s) exposed at this endpoint
Additional content defined by implementations

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.extension` maps as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget to R4 `Endpoint.extension` - extension has change due to type change: R5 `extension` `Extension` maps as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget for R4 `extension`

element.display: Usage depends on the channel type

target.display: Usage depends on the channel type
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.header` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.header`

element.display: Logical id of this artifact

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.id` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.id`

element.display: Identifies this endpoint across multiple systems

target.display: Identifies this endpoint across multiple systems
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.identifier` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.identifier`

element.display: A set of rules under which this content was created

target.display: A set of rules under which this content was created
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.implicitRules` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.implicitRules`

element.display: Language of the resource content

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.language` maps as RelatedTo to R4 `Endpoint.language` - language changed the binding strength from Required to Preferred

element.display: Organization that manages this endpoint (might not be the organization that exposes the endpoint)

target.display: Organization that manages this endpoint (might not be the organization that exposes the endpoint)
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.managingOrganization` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.managingOrganization`

element.display: Metadata about the resource

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.meta` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.meta`

element.display: Extensions that cannot be ignored

target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.modifierExtension` maps as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget to R4 `Endpoint.modifierExtension` - modifierExtension has change due to type change: R5 `modifierExtension` `Extension` maps as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget for R4 `modifierExtension`

element.display: A name that this endpoint can be identified by

target.display: A name that this endpoint can be identified by
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.name` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.name`

element.display: Set of payloads that are provided by this endpoint
Additional content defined by implementations
Unique id for inter-element referencing
Mimetype to send. If not specified, the content could be anything (including no payload, if the connectionType defined this)
Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
The type of content that may be used at this endpoint (e.g. XDS Discharge summaries)
Interval the endpoint is expected to be operational

target.display: Interval the endpoint is expected to be operational
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.period` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.period`

element.display: active | suspended | error | off | entered-in-error | test

target.display: active | suspended | error | off | entered-in-error | test
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.status` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.status` - status has compatible required binding for code type: http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/endpoint-status|5.0.0 and http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/endpoint-status|4.0.1 (Equivalent)

element.display: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

target.display: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
target.comment: R5 `Endpoint.text` maps as Equivalent to R4 `Endpoint.text`
